question.body: Which of the following is not properly matched with its description:

multiple_choice.choice: The duodenum is the first section of the small intestine and contains Peyer’s patches
The Jejunumm is the second portion of the small intestine and responsible for the majority of absorption.
The ileum is the last part of the small intestine and contains aggregated lymphatic follicles.
All of these are properly matched.

response.feedback: Correct. The duodenum is the first section of the small intestine but it contains duodenal glands which produce a buffer to help neutralize the acidic chime from the stomach.
Incorrect. The jejunum is the second portion of the small intestine and does absorb the majority of the nutrients.
Incorrect. The ilieum does contain aggregated lymphatic follicles called Peyer’s patches.
Incorrect. The Peyer’s patches are located in the ileum not the jejunum.
